comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: "The Thirtieth United States Infantry, fresh from their long service in Alaska, marched through Manhattan yesterday afternoon [January 20, 1915] on their way from the United States transport Buford, which brought them through the Panama Canal, to the train which took them to Plattsburg, N.Y., where they will be stationed. " query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9801EEDD1538E633A...

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks artolog, for providing the link to a good article about the event.  We'll add some of this information to the record the next time we update.

comment.author: 76851879@N07
comment._content: looks like the crowd watching the parade is larger than the group of troops in the parade
